content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 0 is:


```arduino
1 -> 6 -> 4
```
The shortest path you've provided uses edges [1, 6] and [3, 4] to reach node 6 and node 4, respectively. Node 6 is connected to node 0 via edge [0, 2], so the final path is 1 -> 6 -> 4 -> 0. Note that this path is different from the original shortest path minus the last point because you've changed the destination point to the previous point.

The shortest path from node 1 to node 4 is:


```
1 -> 3 -> 5
```
The shortest path you've provided uses edges [1, 6], [3, 4], and [3, 6] to reach node 6, node 4, and node 5, respectively. Node 3 is connected to node 4 via edge [3, 5], so the final path is 1 -> 3 -> 5 -> 4.
